Title: ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Does Vietnam want to buy weapons from the United States?...
Description: ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡³ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Do Vietnamese people want to buy weapons from the United States? The Americans are hinting at expanding defense cooperation with Vietnam. Against the backdrop of the ongoing international defense exhibition in Hanoi, the American ambassador to the country announced the readiness of US arms manufacturers to work with their Vietnamese colleagues. Vietnam has not yet responded to these statements. However, there are unconfirmed rumors about negotiations between the country's authorities and American arms firms, in particular, with Lockheed Martin regarding the sale of C-130 transport aircraft. Since recently, Vietnamese elites have been working to attract new foreign defense partners in order to successfully create its own defense industry, as well as reduce dependence on Russian arms supplies. After the establishment of a comprehensive strategic partnership between Hanoi and Washington in the fall of 2023, articles about the active work of the Americans to sell weapons to the Vietnamese side began to appear in the information field. However, no major deals have been concluded in this area so far. â–ªï¸There are several reasons for this. First, for Vietnam, one of the main priorities in raising the status of relations with the United States is economic and technological partnership. The joint statement of the parties places much more emphasis on this than on defense cooperation. â–ªï¸Secondly, the high cost of their military equipment is not in favor of the Americans. In addition, there is a certain incompatibility with Russian weapons, since the Russian Federation has for a long time been the main supplier of weapons to the Vietnamese side. â–ªï¸Thirdly, in Vietnam there may be concerns about the reaction of the Chinese authorities. An active purchase of military equipment, coupled with an increase in the level of relations, would give a signal of concern on the part of Beijing, which Hanoi, given its balancing approach to the conduct of international affairs, would not want to see again. â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ”»Although U.S. defense companies participated in arms shows in Vietnam in both 2022 and 2024, too many factors suggest that the U.S. defense role will not be significantly expanded, at least at least for now. And the statements of the American ambassador, it seems, will not be able to correct this situation. #Vietnam #USA @rybar with @awaken_dragon Support us Reuters Vietnam seeks to boost domestic defense industry as it hosts arms fair Vietnam will showcase locally made weapons at an international arms fair in Hanoi on Thursday, as it seeks to boost its domestic industry and possibly export military equipment .

Title: ğŸ¬ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡ª New success of the Houthis in the fight against Isr...
Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡ª New success of the Houthis in the fight against Israel: what to expect next? Early this morning, fighters from the Ansarallah movement fired another rocket into central Israel in response to the recent bombing of Yemen and massacres in the Gaza Strip. â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ªï¸This time, unlike previous attempts, the Houthi ammunition not only flew to the center of the country, but also fell in Tel Aviv itself, while Israeli air defense systems were unable to intercept it. â–ªï¸Judging by the footage, the rocket hit the children's playground. According to the latest data, more than ten people were injured: some were injured by shards of glass that broke in nearby buildings, others were injured on the way to shelters. â–ªï¸Against the background of the attack, Houthi speaker Yahya Sari issued an address in which he reported on the successful defeat of the target and announced the continuation of the fight against Israel until the aggression against the Palestinians ceases. â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ”»The past attack significantly increased the authority of the Yemeni fighters in slippers as the most consistent and, in fact, the only remaining defenders of the Palestinian people after the signing of a ceasefire agreement between Hezbollah and Israel. Although the consequences of the strike itself are insignificant - the same crater indicates a very small warhead of the missile - for the Arabic-language segment this is a very bright news story, especially in recent weeks, when there were few reasons for joy, to put it mildly. As for the Israelis, it is highly likely that they, together with coalition aircraft, will in the near future respond with strikes against the targets of the Houthis themselves, but so far all such raids have not been able to radically reduce the combat potential -Ansrallah-. Therefore, we can expect a significant change in tactics: since the strikes are not bring the desired result, then the issue of both the need for a ground operation and support for warring factions can always be raised on the agenda in order to incite a new phase of the civil war in Yemen. #Israel #Yemen #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ´ What are Americans doing in Syria? With Turkish act...
Description: ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ´ What are the Americans doing in Syria? Turkish activity in the north has been dealt with. It's time to talk about the USA. The Pentagon announced an increase in its military contingent in Syria from 900 to 2,000 troops on a temporary basis from 30 to 90 days.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–The Americans, of course, arrived in advance. Even before the fall of Bashar al-Assad, the US Armed Forces had an increased number of troops (which, by the way, leads to certain thoughts). But it was in recent days that their activity became more noticeable.â–ªï¸Part of the US Armed Forces went to Ain al-Arab, where they are currently located. Some groups of American military personnel are patrolling in the Raqqa area, on one side of the Euphrates, then on the other.â–ªï¸Several units of the US Armed Forces arrived in the Deir ez-Zor area, spreading out among settlements along the Euphrates due to increased shelling from Arab tribes on the side of the new authorities.â—ï¸At the same time, American MQ-9A drones are on duty in the air, and have also begun to fly over the provinces Homs and Deir ez-Zor carrier-based F/A-18 fighters from the side of -Harry Truman-, which is now in the north of the Red Sea. The strengthening of the US Armed Forces group is associated with the intention to minimize the threat to their interests (for example, fields under their control) due to Turkey or local tribes. The areas occupied by the United States are those villages and towns that are under attack from both sides. High resolution mapEnglish version#Syria #USA #terrorism@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ¬ ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ This morning, Ukrainian formations used drones to att...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ This morning, Ukrainian formations used drones to attack Kazan. According to the latest information, at least eight drones raided the city: one hit the territory of an industrial enterprise, another fell near the river, the remaining six damaged residential buildings in the Sovetsky, Kirov and Privolzhsky districts. Footage of drones arriving in 37- storey residential complex -Azure Skies - one of the tallest buildings in the administrative center of the Republic of Tatarstan. As a result of the hit, the glazing of the building was damaged and a fire broke out. Another UAV hit a 23-story residential complex in Manhattan and a 5-story building on Klara Zetkin. Amid the attack, residents were evacuated from the affected buildings, as well as nearby schools and businesses. Temporary restrictions have been introduced on the operation of Kazan Airport to ensure safety. According to official data, there were no dead or injured. Operational and emergency services are working in the incident area, and representatives of regional authorities, including the head of the republic Rustam Minnikhanov, also arrived at the scene. #Russia #Tatarstan #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ¬ â—ï¸ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ğŸ Chronicle of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict: ev...
Description: â—ï¸ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ğŸ Chronicle of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict: events of the week of December 14 â€“ 20, 2024â–ªï¸Israeli troops continued to conduct operations in the north of the Gaza Strip, including in Jabaliya. Ground operations were supported by armored vehicles and air strikes, and Palestinians consistently reported civilian deaths. Clashes once again took place in the vicinity of Kamal Adwan Hospital, where a large number of refugees are still present. This, however, does not prevent the Israelis from hitting their intended targets, regardless of the collateral damage. â–ªï¸In the Netzarim corridor the situation remains stable. The Israelis maintain a presence in the vicinity of the former Highway 10. The corridor cutting the enclave in two is well fortified and, obviously, cannot be broken through by the Palestinians.â–ªï¸At the same time, the IDF continues to strike on both sides of the corridor, and also improves fortifications. Palestinians often report explosions in the vicinity of Az-Zeitoun and Nuseirat caused by engineering work. â–ªï¸From time to time, local factions of the Palestinian resistance report mortar and rocket attacks on Netzarim. However, they are unable to inflict much damage on the Israelis for obvious reasons.â–ªï¸In the southern part of the enclave, refugee settlement sites in Khan Yunis and Al-Mawasi were subjected to several airstrikes. At the same time, the latter formally remains a -Security Zone,- which does not prevent the IDF from regularly working on it. â–ªï¸Israeli troops also continue to actively conduct operations in the Philadelphia Corridor area. Despite sporadic shelling of the Palestinians, here, as in Netzarim, engineering work does not stop. â–ªï¸Police operations in the West Bank autonomy are also taking their course, where arrests are being made daily. Sometimes dozens of local residents are subjected to simultaneous arrests and beatings.#video #digest #map #Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us Video is too big

Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Chronicle of a special military operation on December 20, 2024. Russian troops launched massive attacks on enemy infrastructure in the Kyiv region. Arrivals were recorded both in Kyiv itself and in nearby settlements. In Boryspil, an enemy warehouse was destroyed during a UAV raid. Ukrainian formations used ATACMS operational-tactical missiles to attack Rylsk in the Kursk region. The strike killed six civilians and wounded 10 others, with extensive damage reported throughout the city. In the Kurakhovsky direction, Russian troops liberated Zelenovka and Konstantinopolskoye, almost completely knocking out the Ukrainian Armed Forces from the right bank of the Sukhie Yaly River. There have also been confirmations of the transfer of Stary Ternov to the control of the Russian Armed Forces. In the Kherson direction, during the night, Russian troops launched a series of artillery strikes on enemy positions in the vicinity of Kherson. Also, messages from the enemy appeared on the Internet about an attack by Russian troops in the Antonovsky Bridge area. Title: ğŸ¬ ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ğŸ´ These are the first real consequences of the Syrian...
Description: ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ğŸ´ Here are the first real consequences of the Syrian events. In the German city of Magdeburg, a driver drove into a crowd of people walking through the local market on the eve of Christmas. According to preliminary data, 1 person was killed and 85 were injured. An unknown person with a characteristic Middle Eastern appearance (many media outlets already call him a Syrian citizen) was detained. The motives, why, why he did all this are not yet clear. But this is exactly what we were talking about during the active offensive of the militants in Syria. The wave of refugees that poured out of Syria was an expected consequence. However, along with the civilian population, others also ended up in Europe. Now we should wait for details, but taking into account the activation of IS in Syria, it is highly likely that it was their supporter who carried out this terrorist attack. Although the Western media will certainly try to promote the version with the Afghan branch of the group. Unfortunately for Europe, we have to admit that this is just the beginning. #Germany #Syria #terrorism@rybarSupport us

IDF units continue ground raids in Jabaliya, while in neighboring Beit Lahia the main phase of a similar operation has come to an end: the IDF press service reported the destruction of three 7.5-kilometer-long tunnels there. In the West Bank, Israeli security forces carried out arrests and searches in more than a dozen localities, while clashes with local militants occurred in Jenin and Nablus. And in Mard, settlers attacked a mosque. In southern Lebanon, Israeli troops withdrew from the settlement of Bani Hayyan, where they had been conducting engineering work for the past two days. Also, IDF units entered the Syrian village of Maaria, expanding the zone of control east of the Golan Heights. ğŸ”»A detailed analytical report on events in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict zone is available on our closed channel @rybar_plus_bot High resolution mapEnglish versionâ­ï¸ Online maps are available by subscription to map.rybar.ru#digest #report #Israel #map #Lebanon #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Description: ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ´ Murder of ISIS leader in Syria: why is the USA doing this? After the deployment of an additional contingent of the US Armed Forces, the time has come to justify the activities and presence of the American contingent in eastern Syria: supporting the Syrian Democratic Forces is one thing, but nevertheless, the Americans have always proclaimed their goal as a noble fight against terrorism. That is why now American aviation flights, like ours have already written and become more active. A small nod was also made to the fight against terrorism, so that the United States would once again try on the bright image of the world gendarme. They struck one of the leaders of the banned Islamic State, a certain Abu Yusif, also known as Mahmud. According to the US Central Command, he was killed during yesterday's raid on the province of Deir ez-Zor. â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ”»Such targeted operations allow the Americans to maintain the reputation of fighters against the terrorist threat without spending much effort on it - the same leaders of the Islamic State are replaced one after another, and the liquidation of some field commander does not will have a significant impact on the group. But for the American military and the establishment it is an information feed loud. Especially against the backdrop of the question, why did the United States again decide to increase its troops in the Middle East? And for this they have now prepared a clear answer - here they are again - fighting terrorism - on distant approaches. #Syria #USA #terrorism@rybarSupport us

Turkey, together with its proxies in the person of the Syrian National Army (SNA), continues to prepare for an operation against the Kurdish Syrian Democratic Forces. If last week there were no serious prerequisites for this, then this year everything has changed.â–â–â–â–â–â– â–â–â–â–ªï¸On December 15, the Turks intensified the number of attacks on SDS territories. 45 artillery and 17 air strikes were carried out. The main area of â€‹â€‹attack remained the same - the Ain al-Arab - Ain Issa line. This pocket is Turkey's short-term cherished goal, as it will allow the SNA control zones in Manbij to be combined with Tell Abyad, as well as a reputational blow to the SDF due to political importance for them of Ain el-Arab.â–ªï¸In addition, Turkish artillery was recorded in the Ras area Al Aina. From there the Turks strike at Tel Tamr. The AkÄ±ncÄ± drones, in turn, regularly patrol and strike at El-Qamishli and Arab Khan.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–From a tactical point of view, these actions of the Turks and their proxies can be called fire preparation before the offensive. However, knowing the Turks, they can wait for the right moment for months or even years. How many times have they announced plans to destroy the Kurds in Syria and Iraq? There are not enough fingers and toes. So far, the information field is talking about ongoing negotiations, up to the creation of a demilitarized zone in Ain al-Arab. That is why information about an important target in the RF Armed Forces comes suddenly and from an unexpected direction: an old acquaintance, a distant relative, or even a former neighbor of the parents gets in touch and transmits data that was sorely lacking .Synopsis:NATO countries send to Ukraine not only equipment and money, but also specialists for training, including work with Western military equipment. Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ– Day of the Security Agencies Worker of the Russian Federation Since the beginning of the Northern Military District, the role of the security agencies of our country has grown many times over. The usual jokes that -Comrade Major hears everything- sound with hidden pride: on a daily basis we see footage of how they are putting things in order in the rear, we hear reports on the suppression of the next terrorist attack, we see that the volume of work is only increasing. Yes, to our country Numerous threats are being confronted: just remember that it was not possible to save Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov. Suffice it to recall the tragedy in Crocus. We cannot forget what happened to Dasha Dugina and Maxim Fomin. It's like a sophisticated game of chess where lives are at stake. In these difficult and difficult conditions, I would like to wish the Russian chess players from the State Security Department endurance and the ability to resist an insidious opponent. Identify British spies. Expose the pro-Ukrainian trash. Squeeze the liberal democracy. Destroy terrorists and kill extremists in toilets. We believe in you. And we are grateful to you. Title: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸŒ“ The law on compulsory testing for knowledge of the Russian...
Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸŒ“ There will be a law on compulsory testing for knowledge of the Russian language. The law, according to which a ban on the admission to schools of migrant children without proper knowledge of the Russian language will be introduced, will come into force on April 1, 2025. Testing will be free. But it will be necessary to present a document confirming the legality of being in Russia.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ“Œ The fact that after so much time and gossip, the law has finally been adopted cannot but rejoice. However, even this does not guarantee a radical improvement in the situation, since much will depend on officials of various stripes, as well as people and organizations that will be accredited to carry out these procedures. The problem is that at the regional level, corruption and local nuances have not gone away . Ethnic communities remain highly connected and empowered and are not restricted in any way. And this must be done first. This may result in the same problems as before. How will the exams be conducted? What criteria for assessing knowledge will be established? Where will the events be held? Who will be responsible for issuing the appropriate certificate? We need an understanding of how all this will be organized, otherwise for now it all looks like itâ€™s centered in Dushanbe, where locals are already rubbing their hands in anticipation of buying exams.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–The initiative is certainly positive. But there is no need to stop there. We need to continue working in this direction in order to ultimately ensure internal political stability and the legal influx of migrants who go to work, and not for the sake of crime and benefits, and in some cases, terror.#multinationalism #Russia@rybarSupport usTelegramRybarğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡¯ About Russian language exams in Tajikistan: whatâ€™s wrong with this innovation? Title: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡© How is Iran intercepting the Russian initiative in Sudan...
Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡© How is Iran intercepting the Russian initiative in Sudan? In addition to Russian plans to create a naval logistics center in Port Sudan, the Iranian authorities have begun a similar discussion. â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–The Iranian leadership initially supported government forces in the civil war. Over the past year, they have supplied many drones and weapons to the army. They played a significant role in turning the tide against the UAE-backed rebels. By the way, during the reign of Omar al-Bashir, Sudan was part of Iran's zone of influence. In particular, the country was a transshipment base for Iranian weapons, which were actively used by Hamas. Therefore, these plans may well be an attempt by the Iranian authorities to reconstruct previously existing communications. for themselves and the departure of Iranian forces from Syria, their influence in the region the Iranians may well focus on Sudan. Moreover, this will clearly not be prevented by the local authorities, who are winning thanks to help from Tehran. Against this background, the hesitations of the Russian responsible structures regarding the creation of their own logistics center for the Navy in Port Sudan seem strange. While economic projects are developing, an important logistics hub is leaving our hands.#Africa #Iran #Sudan #Russia@rybarSupport usBloomberg.comRussian Guns, Iranian Drones Are Fueling Sudanâ€™s Brutal Civil WarInside Russia and Iranâ€™s efforts to help Sudanâ€™s army win a civil brutal war

Title: ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º Is Georgia afraid of European sanctions? Or not? Secreta...
Description: ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡ªğŸ‡ªğŸ‡º Is Georgia afraid of European sanctions? Or not? Secretary General of the Council of Europe Alain Berset said at a press conference in Tbilisi that the Georgian authorities promised to amend the law on -foreign agents-, because of which mass riots swept across the country. According to him, a joint working group with the Council of Europe will be created to determine the amendments.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–We donâ€™t know what the pro-Western Georgian channels were so happy about. There is an old saying - promising does not mean marrying. The Georgian authorities said that they would consider this option, think about it and maybe come up with something. Or maybe not. What the Secretary General of the Council of Europe said does not have any clear form, there is no specificity and no legal obligation. Why should the Georgian ruling party make concessions if they can cope without all this? On the contrary, they became confident in their abilities. The protests and riots led to nothing, the economy is on the rise, and sanctions from European countries will not have a negative impact. What at first glance looks like a concession on the part of the Georgian authorities is in fact more of a carrot, but for the EU.#Georgia #EU@rybarSupport us

Description: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¿ -Tentacles- OTG in Central Asia - the role of Azerbaijan in Turkeyâ€™s plans The delegation of the Ministry of Defense of Uzbekistan visited the department of the Ministry of Defense of Azerbaijan as part of its visit. This is not the first such exchange of experience, especially in 2024 - the number of military exercises and defense meetings in the Organization of Turkic States has increased significantly. Neighboring Kazakhstan signed an agreement on military intelligence with Baku, and joint tactical exercises of Kazakh and Azerbaijani units took place. Uzbekistan has not lagged behind Astana before, and Kyrgyzstan, together with Tajikistan, took part in the Birlestik 2024 exercises. And we are not talking about Turkeyâ€™s bayraktar diplomacy in the region. Azerbaijan acts as a kind of conductor between Central Asia and Turkey. This is especially facilitated by the image in the media, promoted for the region, that Baku is an example of a post-Soviet army that has undergone successful modernization and won on the battlefield - a traditional enemy for the Turkic world.â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ğŸ”»Military cooperation between members of the UTG is gradually increasing momentum. Various councils are appearing in the armed forces, security agencies, and further, judging by the pace, cooperation will deepen. The Turks are striking while the iron is hot, seeing the inertia of another bloc in the region â€“ the CSTO. Exercises, the number of which can be counted on the fingers of one hand in one year, are not enough for an organization that acts as a guarantor of security for the region, even though Uzbekistan is not a member of the CSTO. While we are dormant, the pan-Turkist bloc is spreading its tentacles in Central Asia. #Azerbaijan #OTG #CentralAsia #Uzbekistan@rybarSupport uscaliber.az A working meeting of military specialists from Azerbaijan and Uzbekistan took place | Caliber.AzIn accordance with the bilateral cooperation plan for 2024, signed by the Ministries of Defense of Azerbaijan and Uzbekistan, at the training center of the Azerbaijani...

Description: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡µğŸ‡°ğŸ‡· In South Korea, they fear escalation due to the actions of activists. In Seoul, they continue to talk about the activities of activists who, since the spring of 2024, have been provoking the DPRK with propaganda leaflets and receiving thousands of garbage balloons in response. It recently became known that the South Korean Ministry of Unification has asked public groups to refrain from sending leaflets. However, the ministry did not receive a specific response from organizations. It is unknown whether activists with strong anti-North Korean views will listen to the government's recommendations. After all, their activities, from the point of view of South Korean law, are not illegal. ğŸ“ŒAn interesting point is that before this, the Ministry of Unification took a different position. â–ªï¸Even after numerous launches of garbage balloons and associated financial damage, the department emphasized that South Korean activists have the right to freedom of expression. This means that no one can prohibit them from doing anything. â–ªï¸Now, against the backdrop of the unstable political situation in South Korea itself, the government recommends stopping propaganda activities, as they do not want to worsen the situation on the Korean Peninsula. After all, the DPRK can take advantage of propaganda campaigns and react to them with varying degrees of severity. â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–By the way, itâ€™s not a fact that the recommendations will work in the long term. In the event, for example, that new elections are called and the ruling conservative party wins, the government will most likely continue to turn a blind eye to such activities. #DPRK #SouthKorea @rybar together with @awaken_dragonSupport us ìì œâ€™ ìš”ì²­-í†µì¼ë¶€ê°€ ì§€ë‚œ 12ì¼ ëŒ€ë¶ì „ë‹¨ ê´€ë ¨ 7ê°œ ë‹¨ì²´ì— â€˜ì‚´í¬ ìì œâ€™ë¥¼ ìš”ì²­í–ˆë‹¤ê³  ë°í˜”ë‹¤. Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Combined strike on the territory of the so-called. Ukraine - where were the Russian Armed Forces aiming? Russian troops carried out a combined attack at night on the territory of the so-called. Ukraine. Previously, hypersonic missiles and drones were launched at targets in several regions. â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–â–ªï¸Arrivals were recorded in Kyiv, where several large fires broke out, including in the Goloseevsky and Solomensky districts. There, buildings and gas pipes were damaged and cars burned out on the streets en masse. On the Internet, some Ukrainian citizens claim that fires in the streets are the result of the work of Patriot anti-aircraft missile systems covering the city. However, one can only guess about the specific targets that came under attack. For example, in the Solomensky district there is the Zhulyany airfield and the Antonov plant. Military-industrial complex enterprises such as Kommash are located in Goloseevsky. Both Zhulyany and Antonov are used by the Ukrainian Armed Forces for military purposes.â–ªï¸In the Kyiv region, a warehouse with an area of â€‹â€‹15,000 mÂ² in Boryspil is on fire as a result of a drone strike. Judging by the photographs, this building belongs to the company Costal Ukraine, which produces parts for equipment. Information is also being received about the defeat of the Ukrainian Armed Forces airfield near the city of Vasylkiv. This military base was used to house a tactical aviation brigade before the North Military District, and in recent years it has been modernized to accommodate F-16 fighters.â–ªï¸In the south of the country, numerous explosions were heard in Kherson, and there are power outages there. In the Ukrainian segment of the Internet, reports have appeared that the ongoing attack is a cover for the start of an assault by Russian troops on enemy positions in the Antonovsky Bridge area. In addition, in Poltava, Sumy, Dnepropetrovsk and other regions, arrivals at energy infrastructure facilities were noted. #Kiev #Russia #Ukraine @rybarSupport us

Description: â—ï¸ğŸŒğŸ Worsening of the situation in the Middle East: events of the week of December 13 - 19, 2024â–ªï¸The Yemeni movement - Ansarallah - again tried to attack Israeli territory. The ballistic missile was intercepted over Ramat Gan, and several buildings were damaged by falling fragments.â–ªï¸In response, the Israel Defense Forces launched concentrated strikes on Yemeni territory. The port of Al-Hodeidah and energy infrastructure facilities in the area of â€‹â€‹Sanaa and Aden were hit, and fires broke out.â–ªï¸Israeli aviation also again carried out a massive raid on army facilities in Syria. Most of the attacks occurred in the province of Tartus, where the target was the remaining air defense positions, warehouses with weapons and fuels and lubricants. Explosions also occurred in the province of Deir ez-Zor, where the bridge over the Euphrates River was attacked for the second time in a week. The positions where Shiite groups and IRGC personnel were previously stationed were under fire.â–ªï¸To the east of the Golan Heights, the Israel Defense Forces advanced deep into the Daraa province almost without a fight. Thus, Israeli units occupied the village of Saida on the administrative border with the province of Quneitra.â–ªï¸In the province of Rif Damascus south of Mount Hermon, the Israelis did not achieve significant success. Residents of Beit Jinnah refused to surrender their weapons and forced the IDF to retreat from the surrounding heights.â–ªï¸The rest of Syria remained in a state of instability due to the resulting power vacuum. Jihadists destroyed cultural and religious symbols, in particular churches and Shiite shrines.â–ªï¸Field executions of representatives of the former regime accused of crimes, including officers, continued. However, often the real motive for the murders was belonging to religious minorities, in particular Alawites.#video #digest #map #Yemen #Syria #Iraq@rybarSupport us Video is too big

Description: ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ğŸ‡¹ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¿ğŸ´ Another remarkable news from Central Asia: it turns out that countries in the region are world leaders in repatriating their citizens from camps in Syria where Islamic State militants and their families are being held. According to the Global Fund for Building Community Resilience ( GCERF), in total the Central Asian states returned home about 2,220 such citizens. Kazakhstan accounts for 754 people, Uzbekistan - 531, Tajikistan - 381, and Kyrgyzstan 533. The head of GCERF even sets them as an example for others, saying that while Western Europe is in no hurry to take citizens from the camps of IS supporters, in Central Asia they do this without problems. True, he notes that some of the repatriated women and children eventually returned to Syria.â—ï¸Now letâ€™s remember where exactly migrants from Tajikistan or Uzbekistan most often go. And also the current state of control of migration flows from the region, where strict filtering measures are just beginning to be implemented. So a completely reasonable question arises: how many of these -repatriated- natives from Central Asia from among the relatives of IS militants took advantage of the situation and penetrated into the more northern and a larger country? #Syria #Tajikistan #Uzbekistan #terrorism@rybarSupport usSputnik TajikistanTajikistan has returned almost 400 of its citizens from SyriaCentral Asian governments are world leaders in repatriating their citizens from camps in Syria, the head of GCERF said

The largest stronghold of the Russian Armed Forces in this region was the airfield near the city of Qamishli, which in 2011-2024 was actually an enclave of Syrian government forces surrounded by the SDF. In the period between In 2017-2020, Russian air defense systems, radars, and Ka-52 attack helicopters were deployed at the facility, among others. And in 2021, Su-35S fighters were even based there for some time. The footage shows some of the equipment being transported on Il-76 cargo planes. Apparently, even with all the workload in the Northern Military District zone, military transport aviation is still coping with the task of transporting personnel and material and technical means to Russia from Syria. #Russia #Syria #Hasakah@rybarSupport us Video is too big

Description: â—ï¸ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ Was the collapse of Syria the fruit of the betrayal of local generals? The rapid fall of the government of Bashar al-Assad gave rise to talk that it could not have happened without bribing local generals. One of the people involved in the rumors is Hussam Luqa, the head of the Syrian General Intelligence Directorate. It is still difficult to say unequivocally how reliable the suspicions are. But they look curious against the background of several facts: â–ªï¸Lukeâ€™s predecessor was Muhammad Dib Zeitoun, a supporter of the presence of Russia. After his departure, the structure was cleared of all pro-Russian personnel, sending them from the central apparatus to regional departments.â–ªï¸Since 2020, Luka has advocated reducing cooperation with Russia and increasing it with Iran. He enlisted the support of Ali Mamluk, an ally of Assad, who began to receive interest on every Iranian loan for promoting the interests of the Islamic Republic.â–ªï¸With the worsening economic situation of the country, Luka came into contact with the intelligence services of Turkey and Qatar under the guise of work. It wasnâ€™t that difficult to do, especially considering that his daughter worked at the UN.ğŸ“Œ Whatâ€™s the result? There is a Syrian high-ranking Sunni general not from the ruling clan, who alternately ditches Syriaâ€™s main allies and at the same time has connections with the intelligence of Turkey and Qatar. According to some reports, it was Hussam Luqa who gave the order to end the resistance in Homs and Damascus. He is also associated with reports of a coup attempt, as well as the intention to arrest Assad during the failed address to the nation on December 7. Now the whereabouts of Hussam Luqa are unknown, but if he suddenly surfaces somewhere as part of the new Syrian authorities, this will be confirmation of his role in the takeover of the country by militants. Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ Chronicle of a special military operation on December 18, 2024. During the course of 24 hours, Russian troops launched a series of attacks on enemy infrastructure and industrial facilities in several regions of the so-called. Ukraine. Ukrainian formations, in turn, attacked the Rostov region and the liberated territory of the Zaporozhye region with Storm Shadow cruise missiles. In the Kupyansko-Svatovsky direction, Russian troops crossed Oskol and gained a foothold in the south of the village of Dvurechnoye. There are battles in the area to expand the bridgehead and form a stable front on the right bank of the river. In the Pokrovsky direction, the Russian Armed Forces significantly expanded the wedge in the Shevchenko-Novotroitskoye sector, liberating Novy Trud and knocking out the enemy from several positions north of Pushkino. In the Kurakhovsky direction, according to a statement from the Russian Ministry of Defense, Russian troops liberated Trudovoye and Starye Terny. At the same time, on the southern flank, the Russian Armed Forces completely knocked out the enemy from Uspenivka and raised the Russian flag on its northwestern outskirts. In the Vremyevsky direction there are heavy battles in the area of â€‹â€‹Razdolnoye and Novy Komar. In the latter, contrary to individual reports on the Internet, the presence of the Ukrainian Armed Forces still remains. Title: ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· Why did Algeria and France quarrel? Back in July, Algeri...
Description: ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· Why did Algeria and France quarrel? Back in July, the Algerian authorities recalled their ambassador from France due to the recognition by the French authorities of Moroccan sovereignty over Western Sahara. And now there is the question of a final severance of ties due to the alleged French sponsorship of terrorist groups. The story began with the fact that former Islamic State militant Mohamed Amin Aissaoui told Algerian counterintelligence that French intelligence was trying to recruit him. According to him, he was instructed, with the help of other agents of the French diplomatic services, to collect information about Islamists in the capital of Algeria and Oran, as well as about smuggling networks, involved in illegal migration.ğŸ“The biography of Mohamed Amin Aissawi is quite interesting. In 2014, he secretly left Spain without informing his family. Having joined the ranks of terrorists, the radical Islamist fought in Raqqa, where he was seriously wounded by shrapnel. For treatment, he tried to enter Turkey, where he was arrested. Mohamed was then repatriated to Algeria, where he was released after three years in prison in 2019. And in 2023, the French intelligence services turned to him.â–ªï¸It is worth noting that this is not the only case of support for anti-government forces from France. So, last year, French intelligence services helped separatist Amira Buraoui escape from Algeria. In addition, there were other cases related to the sponsorship of Islamist parties in Algeria. Now Aissaoui decided to cooperate with Algerian counterintelligence, informing them of an attempt to recruit him. This incident served as a reason to summon the French Ambassador to Algeria, StÃ©phane Romate, for a conversation. Of course, the latter denied all accusations that the French supported terrorists. It is likely that this will be followed by an increase in tension, up to the expulsion of the French ambassador from the country. At the same time, the Algerian authorities, in their anti-French agenda, do not stop relations with the West. On the contrary, recently they have been building bridges with other Western powers, mainly the United States.#Algeria #Africa #France@rybarSupport usTSAL'AlgÃ©rie convoque l'ambassadeur de France : ce que Alger reproche Ã  ParisLa crise s'aggrave entre l'AlgÃ©rie et la France. Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º A serious incident occurred in the Murmansk region: a passenger train traveling from Murmansk to St. Petersburg collided with a freight train at the Knyazhaya station. This happened at 16:15 Moscow time. As a result of the collision, eight cars of the passenger train derailed, and one freight car turned over on its side. At the time of the incident, there were 326 passengers on the train. According to preliminary data, at least ten people were injured. It is reported that one woman was pinned between the carriages, and other passengers were injured. The Governor of the Murmansk region, Andrei Chibis, confirmed that ambulance crews and rescuers were sent to the scene of the incident to provide assistance to the victims. It is currently known that the evacuation of passengers from the place has begun incidents.#incidents #Russia@rybarSupport us

Description: ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ–‡The scandal with CNN's report from the scene of the murder of the head of the RKhBZ troops Igor Kirillov and his assistant by a migrant from Uzbekistan actually raises a number of non-trivial questions: â–ªï¸is the activity of foreign journalists, at least from Western countries, monitored at a systemic level?â–ªï¸should Should we expect conceptual changes in the policy of issuing accreditations? journalists who work for anti-Russian publications (a list of them is very easy to compile)? â–ªï¸What measures of prosecution and punishment will affect journalists of Western publications who illegally crossed the Russian border and with their reports misled world public opinion about the goals and methods of the Armed Forces of Ukraine on Russian territory? Of course, none of them covered the kidnappings of civilians. ğŸ“ŒAnd the most important question is how many more such journalists remain in Russia now? And whose activities, both public and undercover, need to be verified. ğŸ”»There is only one conclusion here: expelling journalists from the country and closing editorial offices only in response to sanctions against Russian media is already an outdated practice. Title: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡² Is Aliyev threatening Armenia again? Azerbaijani Preside...
Description: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡¿ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡² Is Aliyev threatening Armenia again? Azerbaijani President Ilham Aliyev said that the Armenian authorities, together with their patrons in the United States and France, must stop rearmament of the Armenian Armed Forces. â–ªï¸Aliyev, in his own style, added that if the militarization of Armenia continues, there will be no complaints against Baku, which actually sounds like another threat. â–ªï¸One would think that Aliyev is denouncing the West for arming another country to create hotbeds of tension. For those outside the context of the Transcaucasian agenda, it may seem exactly like this. However, Azerbaijan has long been looking for a reason for a military operation, and periodic provocations on the border, active reconnaissance by Azerbaijani drones, as well as belligerent rhetoric in the media are evidence of this. â–ªï¸The Armenian authorities, led by Pashinyan, are quite consciously (and under the supervision of Great Britain) playing along with Azerbaijan with new defense agreements, kindly providing new arguments for pressure and threats. Another goal of rearmament is to show that Yerevan can do without the Russian military-industrial complex and without Russia in general. For now, the Armenians are trying to develop a completely new market for Indian weapons and are content with one-time supplies from the French. Therefore, it is hardly possible to seriously talk about the great offensive potential of Armenia.â–ªï¸But Azerbaijan is also not stopping at militarization with the help of Turkey, and they certainly would not refuse a new military operation when the opportunity presents itself. ğŸ”»The so-called peace negotiations between Yerevan and Baku have clearly reached a dead end recently, despite the demonstrative optimism of the Armenian authorities. Nevertheless, in Azerbaijan they are deliberately inventing new demands for Armenia. It is strange that Aliyev does not directly demand the complete demilitarization of Armenia as a condition of the peace treaty, but the Azerbaijanis clearly do not strive to sign it. #Azerbaijan #Armenia @rybarSupport usTelegramBefore anyone else. Well, almost.â—ï¸Azerbaijan is telling Armenia and its allies in the United States about the need to stop rearmament of the Armenian army, Ilham Aliyev said in an interview with VGTRK and RIA Novosti: -We are and will continue to convey both within the framework of the negotiation process and within the commission...

This is what the consequences of Russiaâ€™s soft policy in the post-Soviet space look like : entire republics can live off the Russian budget, give almost nothing in return and demand continued free assistance. Title: ğŸ³ï¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Why should Americans recognize Somaliland? Republican Con...
Description: ğŸ³ï¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Why should Americans recognize Somaliland? Republican Congressman Scott Perry introduced a new bill in Congress advocating recognition of the Republic of Somaliland as an independent state.â–ªï¸Such a move by the American government represents both US interests in the Red Sea region as a whole and reflects their confrontation with China. In particular, to the north of Somaliland, in Djibouti, there is the only Chinese military base in Africa. In addition to this, the Somaliland authorities are able to maintain control over their country, unlike the Somalis. However, the United States has already stopped placing hopes on the latter. â–ªï¸This decision is also being pushed by various think-tanks and certain circles among the Republicans, who said that they would urge Trump to recognize Somaliland, even if this does not happen on the first day. ğŸ“Whatâ€™s interesting is that such a decision goes against past in Ankara, negotiations between Ethiopian and Somali leaders, which, it seemed, were supposed to lead to peace. Therefore, this gesture should be regarded as a slight hint to the leadership in Addis Ababa that they should rely primarily on the White House. Moreover, Washington has already considered the option of removing the current authorities of Ethiopia. And in addition, the Americans are quite capable of getting another controlled vassal, whose position is favorable both for the war with the Houthis and for the confrontation with the PRC.#Africa #Somalia #USA #Ethiopia @rybarSupport us

After numerous interviews, the leader of the terrorist group Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, Abu Muhammad al-Julani, began receiving foreign delegations from Western countries. Diplomats from Germany, France, and the UN have already noted themselves in Damascus . Everyone has the same goal - establishing contacts with the new Syrian authorities. The EU went further, saying that they were ready to lift sanctions in exchange for the closure of Russian bases in the country.â—ï¸But two British politicians were among the very first to visit Syria. The British Commissioner for Syria, Anne Snow, and the head of the Middle East department in the British Foreign Office is Stephen Hickey, who is not even mentioned in the media.ğŸ“Œ Hickey is a very interesting person. He moved up the career ladder very quickly, specializing in the Middle East region. He managed to work in Libya, Syria, Iraq, Egypt and even South Africa. And it just so happened that with his arrival, mass unrest began in these countries, and in Egypt everything even came to a coup. Of course, this can all be called a coincidence, but, as a rule, where the British have important interests, something similar happens there. And Hickeyâ€™s rather rapid rise through the ranks, regardless of the change in the top leadership of Great Britain, demonstrates his skills and importance. True, in choosing Al-Julani the British showed, to put it mildly, indiscriminately. However, after Zelensky, you are no longer surprised by anything: the leader of HTS, unlike the Ukrainian president, at least thought to wear a suit, observing minimal politeness. But no one told Al-Julani that he needed to put on a tie - but the British will probably quickly correct this mistake. Description: Forwarded From Two Majors #Summary for the morning of December 18, 2024 â–ªï¸ The main event of the past day was the murder in Moscow of Lieutenant General Igor Kirillov, chief of the RKhBZ troops, and his assistant with the rank of major. The explosion was organized by the Kyiv special services, who did not hide their joy in the controlled information dumps, but never officially took responsibility. â–ªï¸ Heavy bloody battles continue in the Kursk region, the Russian Armed Forces continue strikes in the area of â€‹â€‹the settlement. Kruglenkoe, as well as near the settlement. Russkoye Porechnoye, expanding the zone of control north-west of Plekhovo. The enemy is putting up fierce resistance. â–ªï¸ In the Pokrovsky direction, our troops are advancing on a broad front south of Pokrovsk (Krasnoarmeysk). There are attacks in the area of â€‹â€‹the village. Shevchenko and Dachenskoye, in the direction of the settlement. Peschanoye, Solenoye and Novovasilevka. Moving from village to village, the Russian Armed Forces close the emerging -pockets-, leveling the front.â–ªï¸ In the Kurakhovsky direction, the Russian Armed Forces clear out the Uspenovsky -pocket-, advance in Kurakhovo itself and expand the zone of control southeast of the city near Zelenovka. Busy n.p. Constantinople, they reported that the area had been cleared. â–ªï¸ North of Velikaya (Bolshaya) Novoselka, our Marines are consolidating their positions in the settlement. New Komar and expand the control zone. If successful, the enemy forces in Velyka Novosyolki have only one supply road left - through the settlement. Vremevka. At the same time, from the south, the Russian Armed Forces are attacking the settlement. Sentry. â–ªï¸ At night, Geranium strikes were carried out on enemy territory against targets in Kremenchug, Pavlograd, Starokonstantinov, the suburbs of Kyiv, and the Kirovograd region. Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ Aggravation in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict zone chronicle of events for December 17, 2024 Israeli troops continue to strike various areas of the Gaza Strip. According to the Palestinian Ministry of Health, the death toll has already exceeded 45 thousand people. In the West Bank, Israeli security forces carried out another series of raids, detaining about 15 local residents. The most tense situation remains in Jenin, where clashes occur daily. In southern Lebanon, formal compliance with the ceasefire agreement continues, although not without IDF attacks on border settlements. At the same time, the Israelis are also working on Syria. Over the past few days, rumors have been circulating on the Internet about unprecedented progress in negotiations between Israel and Hamas. Against this background, various fakes are also spreading - for example, today it was reported that militants were allegedly transmitting lists of surviving hostages.ğŸ”»A detailed analytical report on events in the Israeli-Palestinian conflict zone is available on our closed channel @rybar_plus_botHigh resolution mapEnglish versionâ­ï¸ Online maps are available by subscription to map.rybar.ru#digest #report #map #Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Title: â—ï¸ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ About the reasons for turning off the mobile Internet ...
Description: â—ï¸ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ About the reasons for shutting down the mobile Internet in CrimeaToday, to ensure the safety of residents of Crimea, shutdowns of the mobile Internet are possible, as stated by the press service of the Ministry of Information of the Republic of Kazakhstan. This applies to any operators. It can turn off at any time, and not just at night as before. Many people have questions about why, why, and why all this is being done. Some even began to assume that special forces in Crimea were testing some new equipment for jamming communications. In reality, everything is simpler: SIM cards of local operators are increasingly being found in drones of the Armed Forces of Ukraine, and in some cases there were also mainland ones, and even from the DPR. And now, when a massive UAV attack is confirmed, the Internet will be turned off. So if the Crimeans and residents of Sevastopol suddenly lose their connection, you yourself understand what is happening. #Crimea #Russia #Ukraine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ War in response to protests: how Israeli authorities ...
Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡µğŸ‡¸ War in response to protests: how the Israeli authorities are extinguishing rallies since the beginning of the escalation. The next round of the Israeli-Palestinian conflict has been going on for more than 14 months - during this time, over 1.6 thousand protest events took place in Israel, the lion's share of which were demands to conclude an agreement with Hamas for the return of hostages. Participants in such actions were not only relatives of citizens abducted by militants and everyone who was not indifferent to their fate, but also those who seized on any opportunity to call for the resignation of the ultra-Orthodox government - and there were enough of them throughout their stay in power. ğŸ”»What are the dynamics of the protests? The Hamas invasion of the Gaza Strip itself sharply reduced the number of protests in Israel, where throughout 2023, protests against laws from the so-called judicial reform package arose every now and then. However, the taking of hostages by militants and the IDF's sluggish attempts to return them have led to the emergence of an increasing number of those who disagree with the policies of the ultra-Orthodox. â–ªï¸Until the end of the year, the number of demonstrations was insignificant, including against the background of the populationâ€™s expectations of a quick victorious end to the conflict, and a small surge of discontent that arose by the end of November was quickly extinguished by the conclusion of a four-day truce with Hamas and the return of several dozen hostages. â–ªï¸However, since the beginning of 2024, against the backdrop of successive completions of IDF operations in different parts of the enclave without the expected release of hostages, they again led to a significant number of demonstrations. For the first time, the Israelis managed to quell this with rumors about the preparation of a new agreement with Hamas and an exchange of blows with Iran, but by May the IDF operation in Rafah was unable to contain the tension. â–ªï¸Subsequently, it was possible to calm the population a little only with the murder of Hamas head Ismail Haniyeh in Tehran, however, after the discovery of the bodies of six hostages in Rafah during a rescue operation, the country was again overwhelmed by mass demonstrations. But the sharp escalation of the conflict with Hezbollah helped to calm the dissatisfied: the number of shares decreased by almost 80% from 226 shares in September to 48 in October. â–ªï¸In November, the protest activity of the population increased again - due to the decrease in the intensity of fighting in southern Lebanon and the subsequent ceasefire agreement. Although the actions of progressive jihadists in Syria and the growth of new rumors about an impending truce with Hamas led to a relative stabilization of the situation in December. ğŸ”»What follows from all this? If you connect the number of demonstrations with the events that took place, even for a reader not immersed in the context, a very remarkable picture will open - the ultra-Orthodox government is quite skillful in extinguishing protest activity by gradually increasing the level of escalation. However, we have already noted more than once that for the Israeli ultra-Orthodox elite, the presence of any conflict is an effective and, apparently, the only way to silence their own population. Otherwise, they will simply have nothing to restrain dissatisfied citizens. Therefore, even against the backdrop of rumors raging in recent days about an imminent agreement with Hamas, there is no point in believing in a peaceful life under the current government in Israel - a new escalation will happen in any case. The only question that remains open is where it will happen: Syria is suitable for this, where IDF fighters are already creating a buffer zone, and the West Bank, where you can always fight with local militants, as well as Iran. High resolution infographicsEnglish version#infographics #Israel #Palestine@rybarSupport us

Title: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º Will Russian TV channels be closed in Armenia? The topic...
Description: ğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º Will Russian TV channels be closed in Armenia? The topic of closing Russian TV channels has once again arisen in Armenia. Local media report that Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan is being persuaded to take such a step by Western sponsors. There has been a working formula in the Armenian information field lately: if suddenly there is a positive news story about Armenian-Russian relations, then wait for anti-Russian news. â–ªï¸The other day, information appeared that the Armenian authorities are preparing for the visit of the Chairman of the Federation Council of the Russian Federation, Valentina Matvienko, in early 2025. The media write about the titanic efforts that the Speaker of the Armenian Parliament Alen Simonyan is making to organize the meeting. â–ªï¸Simonyan played a big role in damaging relations between the two countries, voicing odious claims against Russia, but is now working hard to ensure that Matvienkoâ€™s trip to Yerevan takes place. â—ï¸I would like to hope that in the event of such negotiations, the Russian side will work out in advance the issue of preserving Russian broadcasting in Armenia. â–ªï¸With the obvious influence of Western curators on Pashinyanâ€™s team, there are significant problems on our part in the issue of Russian broadcasting. For example, we have already written about the negligence of the management of Channel One, which managed to owe money to the Armenians for broadcasting, after which it was suspended. â–ªï¸Moreover, Armenia claims that it has sent proposals to the Russian side several times to amend the intergovernmental agreement regulating the broadcasting of Russian channels in the republic, but has never received a response. ğŸ”»It is obvious that with such an inconsistent approach on our part, together with the efforts of Western partners, Russiaâ€™s information influence in Armenia is exposed to a double threat. At the same time, the aspirations of the Armenian side to organize Matvienkoâ€™s visit indicate that Yerevan is particularly interested in public contacts of such a high level. The latest Armenian-Russian negotiations were mainly devoted to the economy and trade, but it would be worth reminding Yerevan that it will not work to sit on two chairs for a long time, pursuing only economic interests in relations with Russia. #Armenia #Russia@rybarSupport usTelegramSystemic pesticideğŸ‡¦ğŸ‡²ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º About the possible closure of Russian TV channels in ArmeniaThe Armenian media, citing their own sources, claim that the government of Nikol Pashinyan decided to finally stop broadcasting Russian TV channels in the republic at the request of Western...

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ About the activity of the United States and its allie...
Description: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ About the activity of the United States and its allies in the Asia-Pacific region in 2025 This year has not yet come to an end, and the Japanese press is already beginning to appear dates for exercises in the Asia-Pacific region that will take place next year. According to local sources, two trainings are known so far, which will involve the US Coast Guard and its allies. â–ªï¸First, in early January, quadrilateral exercises within the QUAD format will be held in the waters near Tokyo. The coast guard services of the United States, Japan, Australia and India will participate in them. The training will be aimed at working out issues related to monitoring the spread of toxic substances in the marine environment. The teachings appear to be focused on humanitarian action. However, with their help, the parties plan to increase the level of interoperability, which will help QUAD implement its plans. Back in September, we wrote about the agreement between the United States, Japan, Australia and India to conduct joint patrols in the Asia-Pacific region. ğŸ”»Then in March 2025, exercises will be held near the Japanese prefecture of Kagoshima, in which the coast guard services of the United States, Japan and the Philippines will take part - another quasi-alliance formed literally over the past two years. The training will be aimed at practicing search and rescue operations. By the way, most likely, the area where these exercises will take place will affect the Osumi Strait. Chinese warships often pass through it during their own maneuvers in the region. Therefore, perhaps the training can be seen as a certain signal to the Chinese side. Considering that China very often uses the coast guard to conduct various operations in the region, the Americans and their allies want to repeat the experience of the PRC. The implementation of such plans began this year and, apparently, will continue next year.  High resolution mapEnglish version#USA #Japan@rybar together with @awaken_dragonSupport us

But the clearly pro-Western authorities of Armenia did not follow the general line of discrediting the Georgian elections, which even caused an attempt by protest leader Salome Zurabishvili to spark a diplomatic scandal. â–ªï¸Potential instability among Georgians poses a huge risk for neighboring Armenia, which is connected to the outside world through roads to Georgia. Moreover, in 1993, during the civil war in Georgia, Armenians suffered greatly from blocked infrastructure, finding themselves surrounded by Azerbaijan and Turkey. ğŸ”»Nevertheless, the outcome of the elections in Georgia will significantly affect Armeniaâ€™s pro-Western course in several respects. On the one hand, the fairy tales of the Pashinyan government about potential European integration will become even more fantastic, since without Georgia such a scenario is unrealistic for Armenia due to the inability to provide infrastructure ties with the EU. On the other hand, all Western budgets for building democracy, including American USAID projects, will now collectively flow from Georgia to Armenia, where a similar agenda may intensify, and local figures will once again enrich themselves with grants. #Armenia #Georgia @rybarSupport usSputnik ArmeniaPashinyan and Khachaturian congratulated Kavelashvili on his election as President of Georgia Representatives of the Armenian government congratulated the newly elected President of Georgia.

Title: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ The internal political crisis in South Korea has given t...
Description: ğŸ‡°ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡¯ğŸ‡µ The internal political crisis in South Korea has given the Japanese reason to worry about the future of relations between Tokyo and Seoul. Several social surveys have been conducted in Japan in recent days, with a majority of respondents expressing fear that bilateral ties will once again turn sour. It can be assumed that such sentiments also exist among the ruling elites of Japan, because with the coming to power of Yun Seok-yeol, relations between Seoul and Tokyo have undergone qualitative changes for the better. ğŸ”»The main reason for possible fears is the change of president in South Korea if Yoonâ€™s impeachment is approved by the Constitutional Court. After all, one or another opposition politician can win the election of the country's leader.  The problem is that such figures most often have anti-Japanese views. They, for example, vehemently criticized Yun for bringing South Korea and Japan closer together. Therefore, if the opposition wins in only a hypothetical election, there is clearly no need to expect a pragmatic course towards Tokyo. However, it is worth understanding that, given the dynamically developing situation in South Korea, it is too early to draw specific conclusions about the deterioration or improvement of bilateral ties with Japan. Therefore, the US plans to contain both the DPRK and China with the help of a trilateral alliance with Seoul and Tokyo cannot be dismissed for now. 70 percent of respondents expressed concerns that recent political turmoil in South Korea, triggered by President Yoon Suk Yeol's martial law declaration, could impact bilateral relations with Japan, a Kyodo News poll shows.

Title: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¿ Reintegration of citizens of Uzbekistan - what is the po...
Description: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¿ Reintegration of citizens of Uzbekistan - what is the point of American policy? The United States is ready to support Uzbekistan and other countries in the region in the repatriation and reintegration of citizens returned from armed conflict zones. This was stated by the Deputy Permanent Representative of the United States to the UN, David Johnson.â“The Council was created in 2024 under the auspices of the UN Office of Counter-Terrorism. The initiative belonged to the President of Uzbekistan. More than 530 citizens (mostly women and children) have been returned to Uzbekistan since 2019. And such work is an important step in the rehabilitation of those who suffered from the actions of terrorists or committed a rash act and decided to fix everything.â—ï¸However, things can often be different. There are no guarantees that, under the guise of returning to peaceful life, some of these repatriates will not want to return to their homeland to promote extremist ideology in their country. This could be facilitated by the fall of the government of Bashar al-Assad and the rise to power of radical elements, including from Central Asia. For example, under the banner of Hayat Tahrir al-Sham, the militants of Katiba al-Tawhid wal-Jihad are fighting - a group mainly consisting of Uzbeks. During the active phase of the offensive and after the capture of Damascus, there were many videos with militants speaking Uzbek, in Turkmen and Russian, where they say that after Syria they will come to restore their there is order in our homeland.ğŸ”»So the interests of the American side are quite understandable. Despite the fact that some think-tank structures in the United States consider such a policy to be ineffective, the United States continues to use the factor of terrorism to consolidate its presence in the region. Therefore, the West will certainly help bring back the former terrorists. #CentralAsia #USA #Uzbekistan@rybarSupport usPodrobno.uzThe United States expressed its readiness to support Uzbekistan in the repatriation and reintegration of citizens from combat zonesUzbekistan, Tashkent - Podrobno.uz AN. This was stated by the Deputy Permanent Representative of the United States to the UN, David Johnson.

Title: ğŸ–¼ ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Joker DPR obtained a document from the Administration for...
Description: ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¸ Joker DNR obtained a document from the Administration for Children and Families in the US Department of Health and Human Services, reflecting information about grants that the American government allocates to help refugees and immigrants. The amounts are really large - from 2023 to 2025 the United States will spend for these purposes almost $1.1 billion. It would seem to be a completely standard American document, in which there is nothing special. However, a closer look reveals the overall priorities of the Joe Biden administration in the field of migration policy - namely, the Democrats' desire to catch up with more potential voters ahead of the presidential election. The report shows that funding for refugee support programs shows a decrease in the level of urgency and volume of funds in 2024-2025 compared to 2023. It is unfortunate, of course, that there is no data for 2021-2022; most likely, the financing of migration in these years was also at a high level. The statistics above also show how lower-priority programs are falling away. For example, support for Afghan and Ukrainian migrants. With the advent of the Donald Trump administration, this whole migration story will lose priority. Most likely, only special immigrantsâ€”those who have received the right to immigrate to the United States due to their unique status or meritâ€”can count on more or less stable funding. High-resolution infographics Russian version #USA@rybar in collaboration with @usaperiodicalSupport us

Title: ğŸ” The murder of the chief of the RKhBZ troops, Kirillov, was not...
Description: Forwarded From Andrey MedvedevIt was no coincidence that the murder of the head of the RKhBZ troops, Kirillov, was committed by Ukrainian terrorists literally the next day after the open board meeting of the Russian Ministry of Defense, where both the head of the department and the Supreme Commander-in-Chief spoke. Since the authorities of the former Ukraine attach great importance to various types of PR and information warfare, we can confidently say that the target for the terrorist attack was chosen a long time ago, but the curators adjusted the time to use the murder of the Russian general, with maximum effect for the domestic Ukrainian audience. -It doesnâ€™t matter what they say in Moscow, it doesnâ€™t matter how many Ukrainian soldiers die every day, it doesnâ€™t matter that the TCC grabs men on the streets indiscriminately. It doesnâ€™t matter that they bring energy to us with missiles. Our saboteurs blew up the general. Glory to all of us, there is not much time left before the ultimate victory. Will the murder of the Russian general affect the course of hostilities? Of course not. As soon as it affects the future of Ukrainian territory, the fate of the Ukrainian military at the front. Such terrorist tactics and logic of reasoning are very consistent with the Bandera tradition. When, in the 50s, militants came out of hiding and killed, realizing that they had no goal for a long time, that the OUN-UPA was all over. And there are no leaders. But Ukrainian militants killed without a purpose, simply out of hatred. And the desire to prove to themselves that they still mean something. Well, because British and American intelligence gave money for the underground war. However, I repeat that for the leadership of the former Ukraine, the terrorist attack in Moscow is a way to distract the domestic audience from news about the possible mobilization of youth from 18 years of age. Or from such news.-People 25-60 years old with II or III group disability from the designated line of re-examination of claims will be required to go through the period from 1st quarter to 1st leaf fall in 2025 after the new Law-. Not clear? I'm translating. Men with disabilities are required to undergo a medical examination. I wonder why, right? The population of Ukraine, in principle, understands what this means for them. So the terrorist attack and the murder of Russian officers will not change anything. But for us, this is a reminder that war is near everyone. Literally, here, at arm's length. May the memory of the fallen Russian officers be blessed. We will win no matter what. https://t.me/rybar/66413TelegramRybarğŸ‡·ğŸ‡º The murder of the chief of the Russian Chemical Defense Forces in Moscow once again emphasizes that no matter what successes we achieve on the battlefield, no matter what euphoria reigns and no matter how much we talk about intercepting the initiative, the other side always has the opportunity...

Title: ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ About the political crisis in Canada and the possible resign...
Description: ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡¦ About the political crisis in Canada and Trudeau's possible resignation The Liberal government of Canada experienced a serious shake-up on the eve of the Christmas holidays. Two ministers left their posts at once: Chrystia Freeland, Minister of Finance, Deputy Prime Minister of Canada (and an ardent supporter of support for Ukraine), and Sean Fraser, Minister of Housing. It is noteworthy that it was the economic situation and the housing crisis that became the main subjects of criticism against the government of Justin Trudeau. Trudeau has faced calls to resign in recent months, including from members of his own Liberal party. However, as we see, the Prime Minister decided instead to give the people - the heads - of the ministers responsible for reducing the living standards of ordinary Canadians. ğŸ“ŒThe decision is quite desperate, given that according to polls, the Liberal Party lags behind the opposition Conservative Party by more than 20%, and there is less than a year left before the elections. However, Prime Minister Trudeau still has a chance to prolong the agony with personnel changes. According to rumors, Trudeau offered the position of Minister of Finance to Mark Carney, the former head of the Bank of Canada and the Bank of England, a respected economist. ğŸ”»However, there is now no reason to believe that personnel changes will help Trudeau win the election, as well as retain the post of prime minister until October 2025. The Conservative opposition has already tried three times to pass a vote of no confidence against Trudeau. And the only thing keeping Trudeau and the Liberal minority afloat is the fragile support of other left-leaning parties. And it may disappear as soon as the reputational risks begin to outweigh the benefits of cooperation with the liberals.#Canada@rybarSupport usNational PostTrudeau picks loyalist LeBlanc to replace Freeland after shock resignation sparks chaosOTTAWA â€” Prime Minister Justin Trudeau's government is facing life-threatening chaos after the shocking resignation of Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland from cabinet on Monday, along with the resignation of Housing Minister Sean Fraser, with several Liberalâ€¦

This is especially true for top managers of large companies and military personnel who are not allowed to travel abroad, for whom the restrictions of the European Union are neither hot nor cold. ğŸ”»However, this show still has a goal. While all the media are discussing the motive for including individuals or organizations in the list of sanctions for so-called hybrid operations, the main attention is diverted from economic measures directed against Russian enterprises, foreign counterparties and the energy industry. There should be no illusions here - Western countries are carrying out comprehensive work to strangle the Russian economy, improving the mechanisms of financial pressure. Title: ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª Following France, a political crisis is developing in German...
Description: ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª Following France, a political crisis is developing in Germany. The Bundestag expectedly passed a vote of no confidence in Chancellor Olaf Scholz: only 207 deputies spoke in favor of his government, 394 voted against, and 116 abstained. Now, with a high probability, President Frank-Walter Steinmeier will dissolve the parliament, and early elections have been announced in the country. Scholz himself had already agreed in advance with the opposition parties to hold them on February 23, 2025. What happened is a consequence of the collapse of the ruling traffic light coalition in November, when several ministers from the Free Democratic Party of Germany (SPD) left the bloc. The reason was disagreements in plans to improve the health of the German economy, which is in crisis. So far, everything is going according to the scenario that we previously wrote about. Therefore, after the new elections, you shouldnâ€™t expect changes in German politics with the replacement of -green- with -yellow- or -red- with gray-brown-crimson: the task set by the Americans to destroy the German economy for all of them remains the same.#Germany@rybarSupport us stagesschauBundeskanzler Scholz verliert VertrauensfrageKanzler Scholz hat die Vertrauensfrage wie beabsichtigt verloren. 207 Abgeordnete stimmten fÃ¼r ihn - er verfehlte also die absolute Mehrheit von 367 Stimmen. So far the government has introduced it for 60 days, but with a high probability the regime will be constantly extended as in 2022-2023. â–ªï¸Prime Minister of Moldova Dorin Recean said that Russia is allegedly holding the residents of Transnistria hostage, once again completely absolving its government of responsibility for the crisis. The politician claims that the Moldovan authorities will not leave the PMR without gas, but they will have to pay for it. â–ªï¸Chisinau does not intend to negotiate with the Kyiv regime on the continuation of the transit of Russian gas to Transnistria, through which the republic, among other things, produces electricity for Moldova. They also do not plan to conduct a constructive dialogue with Gazprom and admit the existence of a historical debt for gas.â–ªï¸ At the same time, in Moldova they admitted that in the summer the government did not bother purchasing sufficient volumes of gas, when prices were much lower than current ones. As a result, there is a high probability that the energy crisis in Moldova will be much more serious than in the 2022-2023 season. â—ï¸However, as we expected, the crisis has only benefited Maia Sanduâ€™s regime, and there is every reason to claim that the energy sector has been deliberately neglected to a deplorable state. Firstly, attacks on Transnistria are a continuation of the policy of economic strangulation of the unrecognized republic. For Moldova, the usual gas supplies to the PMR are unprofitable, since Tiraspol is now already introducing restrictions on some types of financial and economic activities. All this will finish off the Transnistrian economy, which is what they are trying to achieve in Chisinau. Secondly, the state of emergency allows the Moldovan authorities, like two years ago, to classify part of their activities and not report on the implementation of budgets. ğŸ”»Moreover, parliamentary elections will be held in 2025, which means that preparations for them, and perhaps the voting itself, will take place in emergency mode. Description: ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡±ğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡¾ Massive strikes by the Israeli Air Force on Syrian territory At night, the Israel Defense Forces carried out one of the largest attacks on Syrian territory in recent times. The Israelis hit targets in several provinces in the northwest, east and south of the country. â–ªï¸Several explosions rocked Deir ez-Zor, where the bridge over the Euphrates was attacked for the second time in a week. Weapons depots in the area of â€‹â€‹the local airfield, where pro-Iranian formations and IRGC officers were previously stationed, also came under fire. To the south, strikes hit facilities of the former Syrian Arab Army (SAA) in the desert area near Al-Mayadeen. Local residents also reported a series of explosions in the vicinity of Al Bu Kemal, not far from which is the famous Iranian military base named after. Imam Ali. â–ªï¸The largest blow was delivered to targets in the province of Tartus, where in the countryside north and east of the administrative center, Israeli planes hit the remaining Syrian air defense positions, weapons and fuel depots throughout the night. Footage with powerful explosions, sounds of secondary detonation and huge columns of smoke was actively distributed on the Internet. During the attack, earthquake monitoring resources recorded tremors with a magnitude of 3.0 in Tartus. â–ªï¸In Latakia, located to the north, explosions occurred in the vicinity of Jebla, and to the southeast, hits were recorded on air defense facilities in Zama. At the Russian Khmeimim airbase located in the province, the situation remains calm. â–ªï¸Several hits occurred on former SAA targets near the small settlement of Al-Shatai east of Homs and targets in the Hama area. Explosions also occurred in the vicinity of Damascus, where in recent days the Israelis have been striking weapons depots in the mountains near Dumayr. ğŸ”»Such raids by Israeli aviation, however, do not cause surprise - for the Israeli government it is fundamentally important to prevent weapons and ammunition of the once-existing SAA from falling into the hands of progressive jihadists. In total, during the period after the overthrow of Bashar al-Assad, the Israelis carried out about 500 raids on targets in Syria, hitting bases, airfields, port infrastructure, air defense position areas and research centers. ğŸ“Œ Simultaneously with airstrikes, Israeli troops are conducting ground operations to create a buffer zone east of the Golan Heights they occupied. There they occupy posts of the Syrian army and carry out explosions of the remaining fortifications and objects, after which they gradually move further into Syria.
